messages.textToSpeech:
Testing is available for all patients who need it, but not everyone needs a test. Testing is not required if a patient has no symptoms, even if they are a contact of a confirmed case or a returning traveller.

At this time, any physician or nurse practitioner can order a test for a patient with cold, influenza or COVID-19-like symptoms based on their clinical judgment. Testing is especially important for groups that are more vulnerable to complications due to COVID-19, people who care for these individuals, and for people for whom a diagnosis will change the public health management or care they receive.

You can access more information on vulnerable people requiring testing as well as the Collection Centre Locator.

You can also ask the Digital Assistant to walk through the Self Assessment Questions and provide advice on who should be tested or treated.
